page.title: 07EGG FARM-INCHINNAN
page.content: Brownsfield Egg Farm,Inchinnan,has been owned by the same farmer for 3 yrs.The farmer's busy day begins at 6.30am,when the 4500 eggs,which are laid daily,are collected and sorted. An automatic sorting machine weighs and grades the eggs,most of which are sold in the busy farm shop.The eggs which are not kept for sale in the shop are sold to local dealers,and some even go as far away as Inveraray, which is sixty miles from Inchinnan. The mobile lawnmowers,otherwise known as Jacob's Sheep,are keeping the grass short in the new car-park,which will be needed next year when the farm expands into "pick your own" strawberries and raspberries.The sheep are also kept for their fleece,which is spun into high quality wool.
